Returns: The cursor for the children of a particular group, or null.
Parameters: Cursor: The cursor pointing to the group whose children cursor should be returned
getChildrenCursor(android.database.Curso.Description: Gets the Cursor for the children at the given group. Subclasses must implement this method to return the children data for a particular group. If you want to asynchronously query a provider to prevent blocking the UI, it is possible to return null and at a later time call @B_android#widget#CursorTreeAdapter#setChildrenCursor_E@. It is your responsibility to manage this Cursor through the Activity lifecycle. It is a good idea to use @B_android#app#Activity#managedQuery_E@ which will handle this for you. In some situations, the adapter will deactivate the Cursor on its own, but this will not always be the case, so please ensure the Cursor is properly managed.

boolean: If true the adapter will call @B_android#database#Cursor#requery_E@ on the cursor whenever it changes so the most recent data is always displayed.
CursorTreeAdapter(android.database.Curso.FullName: public CursorTreeAdapter (Cursor cursor, Context context, boolean autoRequery)

ClassDesc: An adapter that exposes data from a series of @B_android#database#Cursor_E@s to an @B_android#widget#ExpandableListView_E@ widget. The top-level @B_android#database#Cursor_E@ (that is given in the constructor) exposes the groups, while subsequent @B_android#database#Cursor_E@s returned from @B_android#widget#CursorTreeAdapter#getChildrenCursor_E@ expose children within a particular group. The Cursors must include a column named "_id" or this class will not work.
